item.description: Newsom calls for "end to this carnage" after Sacramento shooting. https://t.co/OrYgWBEumq

If the Dems had a passion for humanity they‚Äôd ratify 20 new Supreme Court justices this year, and pass a law that limits the term of a justice to ten years. I am not a lawyer but I read a book written by one and this is what the author recommends, and he makes a compelling case

@jeffjarvis i don't get it

One of these decades the tech industry is going to grow the fuck up and stop insisting on being the boy wonder and respect what has been accomplished before they showed up. Then we won‚Äôt have to constantly be retooling and ripping up the pavement and starting over.

I don‚Äôt buy this idea that Russia can‚Äôt lose in Ukraine, after all the United States lost in both Iraq and Afghanistan. And let‚Äôs not forget Vietnam. A big adult country doesn‚Äôt have to win every battle it chooses to fight. https://t.co/8rjluwpBS3

A Push to Remove LGBTQ Books in One County Could Signal Rising Partisanship on School Boards. https://t.co/6as3xIZ2Cu

@jack In everything I read about bluesky there was no plan to use what was built with rss. I saw activitypub, xmpp, but no rss. jack, as you might imagine, my work builds on rss so we‚Äôll be competing. so unnecessary. Just like a bigco. Come down off your pedestal, be a mensch.
One way Twitter and Drummer are connected‚Ä¶ https://t.co/6a1eeKlaY1
@jack hopefully our stuff works together. good luck.
@wmf that's better than what google did. i haven't heard them offer to help put the open web back together. jack hasn't either, but he did just open the door to it.

A user said he‚Äôd be more inclined to use Drummer if i planned for it to continue to work after I stop working. First, yes I did plan the best I could. All your files are in an open format which can be read by most outliners.
You can easily and quickly download all your files with a single command and you should do it frequently.
If you want it to keep running, help out next time there are new features, get involved in testing. Anyone can do it.
A Realistic Defense of Skiing the East. https://t.co/oyhqXhXg8p

I sat down at the breakfast table to solve the Wordle puzzle for the day. I sad to solve it in less than a minute. Now what to do? Guess I have to get to work! ;-)
BTW -- I find that only my subconscious mind can solve the puzzle, to actually see the solution. I can analytically arrange for the clues to be available to my subconsciousl but the word pops into my mind in an instant. I have no awareness of what the process is.
Usually I'm sure when I have the answer. Today I wasn't even sure the correct word was actually a word! What a nice surprise when all five letters came out green and then did their little dance. üòç

@KenSmith heh this is a question i've been asking for years. in the early days of blogging i tried to get an online news group to pop up to cover Linux. it didn't happen. as long as i was pushing it myself it had momentum, when i stepped back, nothing.
